reviews.review_text: Love the feel of the place. Staff were really friendly and attentive, and the food was delicious. Huge portions for great value prices. Loved the intimate booth we were sat in. Would love to try the floor seating but would never get the old man up again

We enjoyed our food, and like the space. They can improve their service but overall I recommend trying this restaurant. Their eggplant dip and lamb dishes were the best ones! Also their bread tasted very good! The portions are pretty good and the price is reasonable.

This was our first time at the Afghan Horsemen Restaurant. We had been in the seperate room to the left which was booked for a bday party which was perfect. We had a belly dancer come in which was great. If you are hungry and like to share order the Horsemen special platter. We really enjoyed it. They dont have a lot of beer not wine selection, but we enjoyed what they had. Cosy atmosphere, great and friendly service. We will definitely come back!

I visited Vancouver with my mom and brother. We really really enjoyed our time here. Amazing food ( kebab platter that fed us all 3 big!! People), wonderful staff and great atmosphere!! Make sure to put this in your list when you visit beautiful Vancouver!

I love the atmosphere with draped clothes and the private booths or two traditional floor seating dining rooms. Dinner for two was enough for three with leftovers. I was sad to skip dessert as menu looked amazing but I had too much food!

We had a wonderful experience at Afghan Horsemen for my daughters birthday. We reserved the sitting area. The atmosphere took us to a whole new place, the food was deliciously full of flavour and the waiter was very attentive and friendly!

Food here is amazing, and it never disappoints, always tasty, and plentiful. Service is top notch, owner is very friendly and hospitable. They treated us with ice cream and baklava as we were there to celebrate a birthday. Overall, real gem at Granville Island, especially if you like Afghan Middle Eastern food. Can t wait to go back again. Highly recommend!

If there was a way I would have given them 10 stars, the food is absolutely perfect, the lamb shoulder was my favourite, one of the best ones I had in Vancouver. The staff are so kind and friendly it s like you have been invited to their home not their restaurant. One of the best places to have a birthday party. Definitely coming back.

Delicious food with friendly staff. They were really accommodating and explained the menu items for us. It was my first time trying lamb shoulder and it was fabulous. The rice was full of different spices such as cinnamon, turmeric, and cumin with a little sweetness from the carrots and raisins. About the other dish I need to say I usually don t find vegetarian dishes at restaurants super tasty and it wasn t an exception. I didn t like it much. It was good but not for me :))) Next time I ll get the lamb shank.

We sat at the cushion room for the experience and it was fun!! (Not so much if your legs aren t flexible) The Platter for Two was sooo filling, definitely can feed at least 3 people! The portions were really generous. The appetizer of dips, salad, and bread was already quite filling. The lamb in the platter was so tender and definitely was the highlight for me. I really appreciate how much variety was included in the platter. Definitely recommend!

This restaurant in Vancouver is among the finest Afghan dining establishments. My personal favorite is the lamb shoulder dish, and the service is quite commendable. On Friday nights, you can even delight in complimentary live belly dancing. However, the drawback is their limited parking space, which I find inconvenient.

This place far exceeded my expectations! I went in expecting good food, and the first thing you notice is the place has a slick vibe.  When our meals came, just wow - it was all soooooo good.  We repeatedly complimented our meals to the staff, and the staff were very pleasant to chat with as they served our meals and checked in on us. This place is worth the short walk from Granville Island if you are hungry and want a great meal!

Incredible. One of our favourites in Vancouver. The food is amazing, the staff are lovely and the restaurant is beautiful. Our favourite is the Horseman Special Platter - the lamb especially is incredible.

This is a great Afghan restaurant. The food is delicious. The staff is friendly. The decorations of the restaurant are authentic, and the music is mostly Afghan. They are also located in a nice place in Granville Island. So, if you are visiting from out of town, you can kill two birds with one stone and have a good time in Granville Island, and enjoy some delicious Afghan food!
You MUST get the potato boulany. Its like a quesadilla had a baby with a pierogi. Thin and crispy and with a delicious potato filling. Cant wait to come back.

Wonderful experience and great way to spend Fathers day. Food to die for, freshly made and perfect size plates. We were welcomed in a friendly manner and the music made the ambience a perfect experience. I will highly recommend and we will definitely be back soon!

Went here for the first time and it is now one of my new favourite restaurants. It has a great location right at the entrance to Granville island, and the atmosphere in the restaurant is great. We had the floor seating, which made for a great experience- the cushions were comfortable and it was a fun dining environment. We chose the dine out Vancouver menu. Each dish was presented well and was bursting with flavour. The food portions were very generous and made me anticipate my next visit and the other menu items I would try. The service was great and our waitress was helpful in giving recommendations. All in all a great visit, and I look forward to the next one!

Our large party sat comfortably in the Afghan room. We recieved our appetizers quickly which were delicious, we each ordered the large platters which were spectacular. I have to comment on the lamb and the rice which blew me away. I couldnt stop eating! The dessert was also delicious and Im very grateful for the birthday drink. Thank you for a wonderful time! We will be back
Great delicious food we ordered a platter all was great especially the meat tender and tasty

We ve been going to Afghan Horseman for over 20 years, and it s still one of Vancouvers best kept gems. If you re going on a Saturday night, be sure to make reservations in advance, as they have belly dancers. The atmosphere is fun and relaxing, try to get a table on the cushions. We ve had many parties here and the Bally dancer engages with the crowd, getting patrons up to dance with her. Order a planter pot of booze and prepare for a fun evening. Now the best part, the food. The horseman s platter is always a hit, it has a bit of everything and doesn t disappoint. The potatoes are literally to die for. One downside is service can be slow, but to be expected in a busy restaurant. It doesn t sway me from visiting time and time again.

We had an absolutely delicious dinner this evening. This was our first time here and the staff was friendly, patient and very informative. We had two platters to share between four of us which was more than plenty. The food itself was so fresh and full of flavour. On the way out, we had a lovely conversation with a gentleman who I believe is the owner/manager. We thoroughly enjoyed our evening there. We will definitely be back.

Very authentic experience, super friendly accommodating staff and management. If it s your first time going there the Kebab platters have a bit of a everything and feeds 2-3 people easy. Belly dancing was also part of it which made the experience 10 times bette! Drinks are decent too, they could improve their cocktail game a bit just to improve the drink experience but it was still good.

My favourite gem in Vancouver. You can tell it s family owned, everyone is friendly. I always get the vegetarian platter with extra dahl, Afghan tea, a plate of their AMAZING pakawra. My partner gets their famous lamb. My dad loves their soups! Sometimes they have a belly dancer and she s incredible, we would clap and cheer with other diners. They accommodate food restrictions, call beforehand. Try parking up the street or further in advance because the lot is small!

Great place for an authentic, delicious Afghan food. The restaurant has been tactfully decorated in a traditional, cultural, and warm Afghan setting. The staff is incredibly nice and caring! The manager is a great, humble man with amazing wisdom! The food is very very tasty! I recommend their Hummus with Naan! It wont disappoint you! Although the food is a little pricy, it has a great taste! The place is highly recommended!
Good vibes! The food was very tasty. We got the Horsemen Special Platter and it was sooo good, the meat was juicy. The cocktails were amazing. Laughing Santa was my favourite!

Love this place: the decor, the staff, the food.  We were leaving Granville Island, and looking for a place for dinner.  The sign from the street caught our eye. We ascended the stairs, and then really took in the detailed ornate beauty of the interior entry way.  A lot of thought went into the interior design. Despite not having reservations, they seated us.  And politely said wed need to be finished in an 1hr 45m. The place was near empty; but by the time we left, there was not a spare table. The staff was very attentive, and the food was uniquely flavorful.  Next time, well make a reservation, bring friends, and sit in a room with cushions on the floor.
Food is absolutely delicious!!! You get what you pay the price for!! Atmosphere is authentic and different! Definitely one of the most delicious Afghani restaurants in Greater Vancouver

Service was great, server was super friendly and knowledgeable.   We ordered a share platter - lots of food for 3 of us! Drinks were fantastic and in fun cups!  Eggplant dip was so amazing! Meats were cooked well. Loved everything.   Lamb was a bit gamey but cooked well too.
Absolutely excellent food, generous portions, good value and great atmosphere!

I love the vibes! Food, dance and music is really good. I have seeing lots of people celebrating their birthday in this place. I would recommend to do reservations if you want to enjoy authentic afghani feel by sitting on the floor and watching dance. The platters are huge and good for two people. They can work on space because it was really packed!
I loved their chicken cuisine. It is very juicy and tasty. And the skewered lamb also very very good. No need to explain a lot, go and taste! It is worthy of visiting! Food : 5/5

Loved the atmosphere of this Afghanistan restaurant. Server was friendly and helpful,  and food were all tasty. I ordered special plate for two. I usually don t eat lamb meat but their lamb chop was well cooked and tasty! I d like to try other food next time.

This Afghan Horsemen Restaurant at this location : Unit 202- 1833 Anderson Street, Vancouver as always delivers best Afghan food in the area. Excellent Service and the Atmosphere takes you inside a true Afghan tent decorated with the authentic light fixtures true to the traditional Afghan culture. I can not praise this Afghan Horsemen Restaurant enough to give the best review that it deserves. Vegetarian options: Afghan Horseman provides great vegetarian options. Parking: Plenty of parking in front of the Restaurant and the neighbourhood.

Great food and excellent service. Me and my friends had a kebab platter and we were so impressed with the quantity and prices I paid for it . By the end of the night I went home happy and full. Has become one of my favourite restaurant in Vancouver.

The food and ambience here is amazing. I really should dine here more often. My girlfriends and I had dinner here last night and we had an amazing time. I ordered a lamb shank dish and it was fall off the bone tender. The Potato Pakawra(sp?) is absolutely crispy and flavourful. Their beef sambosas shell is so crispy and the beef filling is delicious. I also ordered the Appetizer Cocktail Platter thats really good for 2 people. The eggplant dish thats included in the platter is so good! It was the favourite of our group. Service is friendly and attentive. Our server took time to explain the menu to us and make recommendations. Someone was always coming around to refill out waters. Im definitely coming back!

I brought my indian friend here in october 2023. We were amazed by the food, service, ambiance. The server was Farhad and he was very kind and polite. He made us feel home in Afghanistan. We both enjoyed every seconde of our experiences. The solo belly dancer was so talented, not only she was dancing but grabbed some clients and made them dance. It was very unique to sit on the floor on those afghan cushions. Thank you all for making that day so special for me coming from Montreal to Vancouver.
Very delicious food with great service. The servers are all nice and friendly.

Went here  for dinner with my wife , it was my first experience in Afghan food , we ordered platter , lots of food , eggplant dip was so amazing! Meats were cooked well, love everything, service was great, farhat was super friendly, Thank you for a wonderful dinner;) ! We will be back soon

I went to Afghan Horsemen to try their Dine Out Vancouver menu, it was absolutely worth it. All the dishes I ordered were delicious. The quantity was good enough to bring leftovers home for another meal. Plus, their service was extraordinary. We had to wait for about 15 minutes to be seated, which I didn t think was a big deal, but they were so apologetic and gave us a 15% discount. I had a great experience there and would definitely go back to try more dishes.

First time trying Afghan food and I was impressed. First of all, this place really decked out in decorations because the moment I entered the restaurant, I felt like I left Vancouver. They even have an option for floor seating, which I believe is the more authentic way of eating their food. We came here for Dineout and for the $27/person price we paid, I thought it was worth it. I d say some of my favourite items was the lentil dip, which tasted like an extra garlicky hummus. Their pakawra, which had the best crunch the cauliflower, which came with a the vegan platter. I didn t try the lamb shoulder, but my friend said it was pretty good! There wasn t anything I disliked, but I will say the Baklawa was too sweet and oily for my liking, but thankfully it was a small portion. Overall, this place has decent food (which was well priced) but it s really an experience worth trying. It s a fun place for a date or a group of friends to hangout. They have many vegetarian and vegan options as well. I d love to try more Afghan food in the future and would recommend giving this place a try!

I have been going to this restaurant for many years now and visited again after three years. The quality has not changed at all! The best lamb you can get anywhere in Vancouver and the pakoras are to die for! I hope they do lunch service too soon because it would be great to have both options. Decently priced cocktails too.

This is an amazing restaurant, well worth the effort to find it. When we first drove into the parking lot from under the bridge the sign was over the Megabite pizza shop and was initially confusing. There is minimal parking in the lot especially given how many businesses are in this building. The stairs up to the restaurant is in the middle of the long side of the building. The decor is an experience unto itself. From the fabric draping off the roof, to the tassel curtains around some booths, to the rooms where you lounge on pillows on the floor. There is no rush so we took our time exploring the menu. All the food was flavorful and well presented. The room was social and we could see what everyone else was having too. We will be back and bringing others for this great experience.

Giving an update on this place! I came here 5 months before and recently again on Feb 2, 2020 The service is amazing and the food is very well made. We had this very cute friendly server named Sanam and she made sure that we had everything we needed and provided very quick service. The food was hot and crispy! The meat was delicate, soft, and fell right off the bone. Everything was flavored well. I will come back and I highly recommend this place. Tell Sanam I said hi! All the staff here are very good!
One of my preferred Afghan restaurants. The cuisine is delicious and the atmosphere is authentic! Highly suggested!

I m visiting from Toronto and I gotta tell you this restaurant is special. The food is great in general but the lamb is absolutely phenomenal. The fried potato is also amazong. I d eat here regularly and make special trips to do so if it were in my city! What a gem!

Absolutely delicious from start to finish! I adore the kabuli polow (Afghan rice), the smoked eggplant, and the best naan and dips in the city! The drinks were also delicious, if a bit dessert-y. We arrived without a reservation but the gentleman at the front was great and able to accommodate us at short notice (i will be sure to make a reservation next time as even on a wednesday night it was packed!). Delicious food, i love that they have vegetarian options, and cool decor as well. Will definitely come back!
The most flavourful Afghan cusain in Vancouver. Thanks for tasty foods and best hospitality service. Especially Farhad jan
We had Kocha soup, Baked egg plant and shish Kebab . Absolutely delicious food and amazing service! Loved the ambiance as well. We will be back to try more.

Our go to place in Vancouver Granville Island area for 5 years yet the quality of the food has remained consistently great! Wow, excellent food, great service and above all lovely ambiance! Highly recommended place for spending a relaxing evening with family and friends eating highly quality food in the Vancouver area just next to the Granville Island!

The first thing to notice when visiting Afghan Horseman is the unique decoration, ensuring this place is quite cozy. The service was pretty good, with the server ably attending to the needs of our large group and never messing up an order. The food was excellent. I ordered a lamb kebab, which came with a yogurt sauce, rice, fried potatoes, and a salad. There was ample food and the lamb was extra tender. My mouth still waters when I think about it. One of the highlights of the evening was the giant drinks for 2 or 3 people. It was fun seeing two people with straws drinking out of a massive bowl. Another highlight was the belly dancer. Members of our group even got up and danced with her. Reservations are recommended, because this place is hot and always busy. I would eat here again, and recommend it to my friends if theyre ever in Vancouver.

reviews.reviewer_name: Svjetski kongres ljubitelja cevapa i poguzija
reviews.review_text: Our happy place! Going to this restaurant (old location) for over 15 years and not once they let us down! Great food and excellent service with wonderful atmosphere. The owner is always there to greet us and make sure everything is ok. We asked our daughter where she would like to go for her 18th birthday   and she choose Afghan H.

It was definitely the best domestic restaurant ( Afghan culture) with the most delicious meals that I have experienced in Vancouver. You can completely deattach from Canadian evryday life to an ornamental atmosphere comes from middle east ( from Iran plateau). You can both sit around the table and sit on the floor like tribal life style of Afghan people. Their spices and meals  smell are fantastic remembering you the taste of eastern persia(Iran), Afghanistan, Pakistan and India. Nice and helpful staff helped us to be served quickly. Their prices are reasonable.

Highly recommend the floor seating. Service was excellent and very friendly. Got the Horsemen Special platter - food was EXCELLENT. Special emphasis on the Sabzi Mast, kabuli palaw, and the lamb shoulder chop. An absolute must-try if youre going to Vancouver.
This is amazing experience. This authentic pleace made us feel we had moved in time. Very delicious food. Outstanding quality of dishes. Exceptional table service. Recommended!

So good. Im so full. So affordable. Also so good. Did I mention that? Reservations are a good idea, but it was definitely worth the wait to get in. I have been wanting to go here for years. Very sad I had not made it sooner. Worth the road trip to get there. They do deliver. Parking is near by, you will be grateful for the quick walk after when you are so full.

Afghan Horseman is our most favorite restaurant of all time! The food and service never disappoints, and dishes tasted better than ever! Weve come for quiet dinners, group birthdays, sat on floor, sat at the table/booths....always a memorable experience. Shay is an impeccable host and has remembered our names all these years!! Food: Boulani is to-die for... eggplant, cabbage rolls & dahl are all-time faves...lamb kebobs, lamb shoulder are mouth watering good, fall-off-the-bone, a flavor like no other... Already planning our visit back :)

A lovely place with amazing food. Highly recommend the lamb shoulder & lamb shank. It s so soft and tender. Slides right out from the bone. Effortless with the bone in meats. Great portion of food. Much deserved 5/5!

Being away from home, I wanted to try some authentic Afghan food, and these guy didnt disappoint. Starting with the staff who were super friendly and always checked up on me. I ordered the mix kabob grill, I thought it was really good but some might say it was on a dry side but it all depends on how you like your meats cooked. The rice and bread tasted fresh. I finished it off with some fresh tea and I was at peace again. Will definitely be back next time.

Had a girls night dinner here on a Thursday evening during Dine Out Vancouver.  The Dine Out menu options were fabulous.  We requsted a table in the back room where we could sit in an L shape on cushions on the floor.  We were a party of 10 and it was a great experience.  The platters of food were diverse and plentiful.  The cocktails were delicious.  The vibe was chill and the service was wonderful!! We all had an amazing time and will be back!!

2nd Time coming back for their dineout. The food is amazing, especially if you like lamb. The decor and atmosphere is unique. When you make reservations, please specify if you want table seating or floor/carpet seating. Great for large parties.
The meat lover platter is delightful. Everything about this place is great. Excellent service, good, and atmosphere. Highly recommend!

Afghan Horseman Price: $24 pp (Dine out pricing) Taste: 4.9 / 5 Atmosphere: Seating: Price Performance ratio:  4.9 / 5 Rentention Rate: 100% abso-freaking-lutely Thoughts: The mantu (Afghan dumplings) are amazing wonderful ambiance All the staffs were very friendly LOVE THEIR RICE! they added raisin in it and its slightly sweet. Very unique We also loved the fried potato! super crispy Excellent Lamb shoulder. Super tender and loved the char Good kebobs but I prefer the ground meat kebobs (personal preference only) Final thoughts: A bit hard to find the location. Its on the 2nd floor.

Had another great experience at Afghan Horsemen once again. This place never fails to disappoint, especially if you choose the floor seating and order the platter. A true Afghan dining experience like no other place in town. Highly recommend if you haven t been here yet. Only downside was that they had one tune playing on repeat which got kinda boring after a while.

Food was delicious.  Flew in from Toronto and was craving some afghan food! I found Afghan horseman and boy am I glad!! Beautiful seating arrangement along with some beautiful paintings on the walls. Very Nice portraits!

Our second time going and it was amazing! Finally got to try the Mantu and I am in love!  Friendly staff and delicious food. We ordered the Aushak, Afghan Aushak, Mantu, beef kabob and the appetizer platter. The afghan Aushak has a lot more cilantro in it than the regular one.

This is my First try to Afghan Cuisine   I really loved everything   the food is too good and so Yumm    The ambiance is fantastic and very classy   My personal favorite is Afghan Phirni   i had there and also packed to Go   Really a must try   Keep the good work guys

What an experience. Food was mouth watering. Lamb was slow cooked and delicious. Had our meal on the ground couch. Reminded me so much of the time I visited Yemen. Definitely a place for a different vibe and taste.
Staff and food were amazing on a busy Saturday night and the unexpected belly dancer was the cherry on top. We are definitely planning a return.

I m a food blogger, I tried chef specials and I tried more than 8 dishes they were all spot on. The bely dancer s dance was awesome,  I met this fantastic server his name is Farhad or Farhan, He is fantastic at his work., This man can speak many languages which is impressive.I will come back again

Came in here with no reservation on a busy Friday night service and the owner/manager was incredibly accommodating in allowing us to eat in the Afghan dining room. It was quite an experience and the food was delicious!
Very impressed with the quality of their meat - exquisite. As a first time customer here, I had a great time. Ate so much, I could barely walk, which goes to show how good their food was.

Walked in on a Tuesday evening and was seated in about 10 minutes. It was a full house, so Id recommend reservations, even on a week day. Service was efficient and menu was extensive. We ordered the special platter to try a bit of everything. It started with a salad and pita with hummus and another sauce (not pictured). The entree platter came with a chicken skewer, a beef skewer, roasted lamb shoulder (the best part), grilled eggplant (the 2nd best part), and cabbage rolls over a lovely bed fragrant rice. There were also deep fried potato slices around the platter. The platter is recommended for 2, but there was plenty leftover, even between two hungry adults. The decor was classic and had a nice ambiance. The outdoor seating seems gorgeous (surrounded by plants)   I hope to sit there next time! There are booth seats and floor seats, as well as regular tables. The Afghan Horsemen lives up to their reputation. Cant wait to come back and try more!
Everything was 5 stars. Food, service, ambience, prices, comfort. Definitely one of my favorite spots to come back to
Food was good  , and the server ZARA was nice with her smiling attitude! Little bit slow as we wait a long time but really appreciate it. Highly recommended

Definitely won t be the last time enjoying a feast at @afghanhorsemen! . . Kebab platter delight for the meat lovers! (2 chicken, 2 lamb and 2 beef). . . Being the first Afghani restaurant in Canada, this hidden gem offers delectable Afghani dishes for both meat lovers and vegetarians! I love the Kebabs that came with this dish as they were all super juicy. What surprised me the most however was probably how delicious the Pakawra (batters fried potatoes) were! The batter wasn t too thick or too greasy. The baked rice (aka Kabuli Palaw) was also very flavourful. This platter was worth every single cent. . See Instagram for more photos and descriptions! . #afghanfood #afghani #kebab #kebabs #pakawra #kabuli #meatlover #meatplatter #platter #feast #feastagram #granvilleisland #granvillestreet  #dailyhivevan  #dieinvan #yvreats #vancityeats  #yvrfoodies #vancouvereats #ufeastwefeast  #dishedvan #yelpvancouver  #vancouverfoodie  #gastropostvan  #vancouverfood  #vancityexplore  #foodork #eatcouver #vandiary #topvancouverrestaurants
Food is soooo goood, Service not bad, atmosphere is good too. Liked it very much.

Came here during dine out, we each has a 3 course meal for $20 each! The food was so delishious and their chefs are really good with gluten free dishes. The portions are huge! So make sure youre hungry. We got to sit in the Afghan room, where we had to remove our shoes and coats. In the room we sat on cushions on the floor! It was very comfortable and a really unique experience.

The hype is real. I ve heard plenty of experiences and I can say it was excellent. We sat in the pillow room. Ordered the Horsemen Platter with meat and vegetables. They skewers are really good. BBQ lamb was fall off the bone. Services was really good.
Food here is amazing, and it never disappoints, always tasty, and plentiful. Service is top notch, . Can t wait to go back again. Highly recommend! Food

Best afghan Restaurant I have ever been to and I have been to alot. The staff was attentive. As soon as she found out I was afghan she started conversing in Dari with me and recommended dishes. The place was decorated nicely and they had a place where you could sit on the floor (not literally). If you ever want to know what real afghan food tast like, go there.
Amazing hospitality by Farhad Tried their veg platter and its worth every penny Food

The only thing better than their service is their food. This place is amazing and if you like lamb you must come here. If you dont like lamb you should still come here. There are options to sit at a standard table and chair or you can choose a more traditional floor seat. They have some interesting drink choices. Overall i have been here twice and I will keep coming back. Excellent place.

First off, this was my third time eating here at Afghan Horsemen, and I never leave here disappointed! Make sure to come on the weekend, as there is belly dancing! This time we got the Kebab Platter and the Horsemens Special Platter, which was split amongst four people. Its definitely a lot of food for four people. The lamb skewers as well as the chicken skewers were very juicy and flavourful! The lamb shoulder was cooked to perfection and just the meat just melted right off the bone. Along with the meat was various other sides, such as their fried potatoes, cabbage rolls (?),  as well as their Afghan rice. All of it complimented the skewers very nicely! I highly, highly recommend this place. You wont get a more authentic Afghan experience here in Vancouver!
Lovely staff, they provided a feast in less time than it took us to figure out what we wanted to order. Great flavors & massive portions

Five stars experience, thats for sure! Its perfect 88/100 health inspection score on tomati io just caught my eye. Decided to have a family dinner there and absolutely loved it! Authentic food and decor, unique ambiance, friendly service... They have a very large menu with plenty of vegetarian dishes so I ordered a vegetarian platter - my kabuli palaw was delicious and I especially enjoyed a cooked spinach. My friend ordered lamb shish kebab - the lamb was from NZ, very tender and flavorful. Will come back on weekend to watch a belly dancer, that must be fun.
Love the vibe, ambiance and little touches with the Ariana airlines posters. Brought me back to beautiful Afghanistan. The food was so good especially the bademjan.

Very fancy with variety of Afghani and Iranian musics (the only odd part but surely welcoming for Iranian guests as we saw a few of them inside). The food was delicious but a little pricy. Overall, very pleasant and recommended.

Amazing place, we were accommodated in the Afghan Room. Floor level seating. Very cool! My colleague and I tried the Tasters Platter for both, the appetizer and the main; excellent portions and lovely falling off the bone NZ Lamb! Yummy! We didnt have a reservation but, the staff gave us a window of two hours,  very hospitable.

What an awesome restaurant.  Live dance, great food .. like really really good food... decent bar set up.  Really cool sitting arrangements. I suggest getting the room ... i think overall this is one of those places that should be visited by everyone
Beautiful place, beautiful food and the amount of food you get for the price is amazing. If youre in the area, Id recommend this place. Lamb shank was delectable
MOST DELICIOUS AFGHAN FOOD I HAVE EVER EATEN EVER. WE GOT THE HORSEMEN PLATTER AND IT WAS A WORK OF ART THAT IS NOW IN OUR STOMACHS. I WILL BE BACK TO CONSUME MORE.
The eggplant dish changed my life. Great portions & price. We were even blessed by a belly dancer! Truly an experience.

I ordered the Mantu, it was very delicious. The decor here is great and the servers are friendly. I will say the food was pretty slow to come out of the kitchen but its worth it. Looking forward to coming back and trying more items!
It was wonderful experience in dining there.. Mr Farhad was the very good in his hospitality and guidance.. cheers.. highly recommend...
Delicious food and friendly service. Thank you The dancer was wonderful!!
Really lovely atmosphere. Very yummy food. Quite accommodating to allergies. I enjoyed their vegan options!
We booked their traditional seating arrangement for 14 people for the ladies bday. Food was amazing and the portions was great.

My favourite restaurant of all time, i love sitting on the cushions, i love the middle eastern decor & music, i love the lentil soup, the chicken kebab plate, the afghan tea, from start to finish i enjoy every second of it & this is the most worth it money you will spend on dinner.

I have been here couple of times, always order lamb shoulder.. really juicy and well cooked... I always wanna try the platter but it is too expensive for just two... The phirni is also great and huge portion... Reservation is recommended.. if you wanna sit inside on the floor to experience the Afghan dining.. sometimes they have belly-dancing live show as well..
This is an amazing restaurant! It was my first time trying Afghan food. It was great experience. The food was fresh and tasty!
